title: About Beacon
snippet: Learn about the vision, technical excellence, and development philosophy behind Beacon HFT platform.
content: About Beacon. The Vision. Technical Excellence. Development Philosophy. Contact. Beacon represents the culmination of years of experience in high-frequency trading technology. Built from the ground up to solve the real challenges of algorithmic trading development, testing, and deployment. Sub-microsecond latency capabilities and enterprise-grade reliability. Modern C++20 with concepts and consteval. DPDK for kernel bypass networking. Custom memory allocators and object pools. Real-time market data processing. High-precision timing and latency measurement. Beacon provides the foundation for serious algorithmic trading strategies that can compete at the highest levels.

title: Command Center
snippet: Beacon's central hub for managing your HFT trading system components - Strategy API, datasets, matching engine, and market data.
content: Command Center. Beacon HFT Platform. Strategy API. Author datasets. Pulse market data. Match engine. Core system architecture. Build trading strategies with microsecond latency. Create and tailor datasets with statistical modeling. Stream market data with realistic exchange simulation. Experience authentic trading conditions with realistic fills and market impact. High-frequency trading development and testing platform.

title: Strategy API
snippet: Professional C++ API for developing high-frequency trading algorithms with sub-microsecond latency.
content: Strategy API. C++ trading algorithm development. HFT strategies. Market data processing. Order management. Real-time trading. onMarketDataReceived. onOrderConfirmed. onOrderFilled. onOrderRejected. BaseAlgorithm. ExampleStrategy. Modern C++20. Template metaprogramming. Zero-overhead abstractions. Microsecond latency. Professional trading algorithms.

title: Matching Engine.
snippet: True Competition. True Exchange Behavior.
content: Matching Engine. Beacon. | Matching Engine. â† Command Center Matching Engine. True Competition. True Exchange Behavior. Beacon's Pipeline. â†’ A queue of quotes and execution messages. â†’ All participants' market activity. â†’ Ordered by a quote a . from entry to execution and notification. Pipeline's Reordering. â†’ Datasets contain quotes. â†’ Quotes trigger orders. â†’ Orders trigger executions. All participant activity is inserted back into the Pipeline and reordered as necessary. Market Participant. â†’ Consumes market data. â†’ Performs any execution. â†’ Strategy and Expediter. Expediter. â†’ Your competition. â†’ Sees quotes first. â†’ Highly tunable. Beacon's Pipeline. Adding Your Quotes. â†’ Beacon's Pipeline starts at Beacon's Playback application. â†’ No configuration required on your part. â†’ Most importantly. â†’ Per your config, Playback adds quotes to the Pipeline. â†’ Both your strategy and Beacons's Expediter will see quotes. â†’ Likely one will react and message Beacon's Matching Engine. â†’ All messages sent to the Matching Engine are sent to Beacon's Pipeline. â†’ Note that both execution messages and quotes maintain a strict order in the Pipeilne. â†’ Specifically, new quotes aren't sent from the Pipeline prior to execution messages. â†’ The same is true for all messaege types, including trades, that impact the book. Competition Option 1: Automatch. â†’ If your strategy has no competition, then execution is futile. â†’ Beacon't Matching Engine offers a configurable Automatch. â†’ The Matching Engine listens to your quote stream. â†’ Automatch processes quotes faster as it runs inside the Matching engine. â†’ It can be configured to be as aggressive as you'd ilke. â†’ Note that you can run a handful of Automatchers per product. Competition Option 2: Multiple Strategies. â†’ Beacon supports running multiple strategies at once. â†’ You can run multiple strategies simultaneously. â†’ This method can prove to be even more accurate. â†’ Especially if you're running the same strategy with different settings. Matching Enfgine Functionality. â†’ Whenever the matching receives an order, it is filled or queued. â†’ All message from strategies are sent back into the quote stream, and properly ordered for all to see. â†’ This includes trades, submits, updates, and cancels, â†’ If an Automatch occurs, this is considered a trade. â†’ These messages are sent back to the quote stream and properly ordered as well.

Quick Iteration. â†’ Save dataset configs. Tweak. â†’ Re-run. Same config. New dataset. â†’ Save datasets. Predictability. â†’ Create 100k quotes in seconds. â†’ Displayed in Beacon's Dataset Playback. snippet: Create your own HFT marketplace. Make the rules.Build winning strategies. Beacon is here to guide you.
content: Beacon Command Center - Professional HFT Platform Command Center. Create your own HFT marketplace. Make the rules. Build winning strategies. Beacon is here to guide you. Enter, Beacon. â†’ Define the marketplace. â†’ Learn about datasets. â†’ How datasets drive Beacon. â†’ Create, tailor your own. Strategy API. â†’ Create your strategy. â†’ Use Beacon's simple API. â†’ Highly extensible, flexible. â†’ HFT-optimized throughout. Start with an idea. â–¶ Use Beacon's Simple API. Examples provided. Implement your strategy. Nothing else required. â–¶ Create a basic dataset. Web-based UI guides you. Flexibility and fine-tuning. â–¶ Wire it up to Beacon. Single Start button. Dependency auto check. Detailed report at the end. â–¶ Detailed reporting. Latency bottlenecks. Pnl high/low/drawdowns. Fill ratios. Strategy Messaging. Deploy with Confidence. â–¶ Streaming options. Playback speeds. Spike & bursts. â–¶ Simulate disasters. Missing or malformed data. Your strategy can't keep up. Exchange delays. Strategy crashes. â–¶ Risk Management. 3-tier system. Pnl, drawdowns. Product positions. Messaging thresholds. Plug in your own. â–¶ Testability. GTest, CMake, and MOQs. Easily add your own. Stream. â†’ Stream your dataset. â†’ Your liquidity is available. â†’ Strategy gets your quotes. â†’ React as desired. Match. â†’ Receive orders, ack client. â†’ Your dataset is liquidity. â†’ Match or queue orders. FIFO. â†’ Use Automatch to compete.

title: Matching Engine - Beacon HFT Platform
snippet: A real-time FIFO matching engine. Driven by your curated dataset.
content: Matching Engine - Beacon HFT Platform DEMO MODE Matching Engine. A real-time FIFO matching engine. Driven by your curated dataset. Instant Local Liquidity Liquidity is sourced from your dataset and broadcast locally via UDP. Both your strategy and the Matching Engine receive quotes instantly. No network team requiredâ€”everything stays on your machine. Strategy Interaction Your strategy interacts with the Matching engine by submit, update and cancel order operations. You will receive an immediate ack or reject and your strategy can act accordingly. The Matching Engine notifies you immediately when you're filled, an unsolicited cancel or trading halt. Automatch Sometimes you want your strategy to compete for liquidity. Not always take it all. The Automatcher addresses this by matching orders based on their time spent in the queue. Your strategy is notified of these matches via trade messages in the quote stream. Scalability The Matching Engine has multiple extension points; so you can adapt it as your needs change. Run competing strategies simultaneously. Desired market-making behavior, or order types. Built with flexible architecture, enhancements feel natural, not forced.

title: Matching Engine.
snippet: True Competition. True Exchange Behavior.
content: Matching Engine. Beacon. | Matching Engine. â† Command Center Matching Engine. True Competition. True Exchange Behavior. Beacon's Pipeline. â†’ A queue of quotes and execution messages. â†’ All participants' market activity. â†’ Ordered by a quote a . from entry to execution and notification. Pipeline's Reordering. â†’ Datasets contain quotes. â†’ Quotes trigger orders. â†’ Orders trigger executions. All participant activity is inserted back into the Pipeline and reordered as necessary. Market Participant. â†’ Consumes market data. â†’ Performs any execution. â†’ Strategy and Expediter. Expediter. â†’ Your competition. â†’ Sees quotes first. â†’ Highly tunable. Beacon's Pipeline. Adding Your Quotes. â†’ Beacon's Pipeline starts at Beacon's Playback application. â†’ No configuration required on your part. â†’ Most importantly. â†’ Per your config, Playback adds quotes to the Pipeline. â†’ Both your strategy and Beacons's Expediter will see quotes. â†’ Likely one will react and message Beacon's Matching Engine. â†’ All messages sent to the Matching Engine are sent to Beacon's Pipeline. â†’ Note that both execution messages and quotes maintain a strict order in the Pipeilne. â†’ Specifically, new quotes aren't sent from the Pipeline prior to execution messages. â†’ The same is true for all messaege types, including trades, that impact the book. Competition Option 1: Automatch. â†’ If your strategy has no competition, then execution is futile. â†’ Beacon't Matching Engine offers a configurable Automatch. â†’ The Matching Engine listens to your quote stream. â†’ Automatch processes quotes faster as it runs inside the Matching engine. â†’ It can be configured to be as aggressive as you'd ilke. â†’ Note that you can run a handful of Automatchers per product. Competition Option 2: Multiple Strategies. â†’ Beacon supports running multiple strategies at once. â†’ You can run multiple strategies simultaneously. â†’ This method can prove to be even more accurate. â†’ Especially if you're running the same strategy with different settings. Matching Enfgine Functionality. â†’ Whenever the matching receives an order, it is filled or queued. â†’ All message from strategies are sent back into the quote stream, and properly ordered for all to see. â†’ This includes trades, submits, updates, and cancels, â†’ If an Automatch occurs, this is considered a trade. â†’ These messages are sent back to the quote stream and properly ordered as well.

title: System Requirements
snippet: Beacon runs on all major operating systems and requires only a few modern tools.
content: System Requirements System Requirements Beacon runs on all major operating systems and requires only a few modern tools. Supported Operating Systems Linux (Ubuntu 20.04+ recommended) macOS (Monterey+) Windows 10/11 (WSL2 recommended) Software & Network Python 3.9+ Node.js 18+ Modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari) Stable internet connection Ports 80, 443, 3000, 8000 open (as needed)

title: Matching Engine - Beacon HFT Platform
snippet: A real-time FIFO matching engine. Driven by your curated dataset.
content: Matching Engine - Beacon HFT Platform DEMO MODE Matching Engine. A real-time FIFO matching engine. Driven by your curated dataset. Instant Local Liquidity Liquidity is sourced from your dataset and broadcast locally via UDP. Both your strategy and the Matching Engine receive quotes instantly. No network team requiredâ€”everything stays on your machine. Strategy Interaction Your strategy interacts with the Matching engine by submit, update and cancel order operations. You will receive an immediate ack or reject and your strategy can act accordingly. The Matching Engine notifies you immediately when you're filled, an unsolicited cancel or trading halt. Automatch Sometimes you want your strategy to compete for liquidity. Not always take it all. The Automatcher addresses this by matching orders based on their time spent in the queue. Your strategy is notified of these matches via trade messages in the quote stream. Scalability The Matching Engine has multiple extension points; so you can adapt it as your needs change. Run competing strategies simultaneously. Desired market-making behavior, or order types. Built with flexible architecture, enhancements feel natural, not forced.

Burst, spike, and control playback speed for robust testing. How it Works: Select a dataset youâ€™ve created or uploaded. Configure playback speed, burst, and spike controls. Stream the dataset to your strategy container. Monitor results and iterate quickly.
